questions.question: What is Chemistry?
options: The study of the structure of a plant or animal
The branch of science that deals with the structure of matter and how the fundamental constituents of the universe interact
The branch of science that studies the properties of matter and how matter interacts with energy
The study of all living organisms (and dead organisms, like fossils)

questions.question: What are atoms?
options: Atoms are the extremely small building blocks of all matter
Atoms are large conglomerations of molecules
Atoms are composed solely of protons
Atoms are imaginary constructs used only in theoretical physics

questions.question: What is a molecule?
options: A group of two or more atoms (Molecules are the smallest unit of a substance that has the same qualities of that substance)

questions.question: What are bonds?
options: Bonds are invisible lines connecting atoms
Bonds are physical connections between atoms
Bonds are electromagnetic fields surrounding atoms
Chemical bonds that hold together atoms in molecules

questions.question: What are electrons, neutrons, and protons made of?
options: They are made up of smaller atoms
They are made up of photons, the basic units of light
They are made up of molecules
They are made up of quarks, which are fundamental particles and cannot be broken up

questions.question: What is a protein?
options: Proteins are small molecules found in minerals
Proteins are long chains of amino acids

questions.question: What is an amino acid?
options: Special molecules used by living organisms to make proteins

questions.question: What is a carbohydrate?
options: Molecules in our body that store energy and provide structure

questions.question: Which of these is not a type of carbohydrate?
options: Carbohydrates are not classified into different types

questions.question: What are nucleic acids?
options: Large proteins found in the cell
Small molecules that provide structural support to the cell
Nucleic acids are how information is stored and transferred in a cell
Nucleic acids are only found in plant cells

questions.question: What are DNA and RNA made of?
Which of these is not a difference between DNA and RNA?
options: RNA has uracil and DNA has thymine
DNA is only found in animal cells, while RNA is found in plant cells
RNA has 1 strand and DNA has 2 strands

questions.question: Where is RNA found?
options: RNA is found throughout the cell (made in nucleus and go to ribosomes)
RNA is found only in the mitochondria of the cell
RNA is found only in the cell membrane
RNA is found only in the cytoplasm of the cell

questions.question: Where is DNA found?
options: DNA is found only in the mitochondria of the cell
DNA is found only in the cytoplasm of the cell
DNA is found primarily in the cell nucleus and in small amounts in mitochondria
DNA is not found in the cell at all

questions.question: What role do proteins play in the body?
What is a molecule made of?
options: Two or more atoms bonded together
